page.title: 14Features of their work.
page.content: A special instrument deep inside the ground measures earth movements as the moon and sun pull the earth. Computers help in the work at the Institute by processing infomation received from the work at sea, and in the weather measurements. Another use for their computers is Mathematical " Models ". These are predictions of water movements, like storm surges, in harbours or estuarys: eg in the River Thames, for the recent building of the flood barrier. The Institute has even been able to calculate tides of long ago; they have worked out tides which brought William the Conqueror in 1066. The Oceanographic Institute now employs 100 full_time workers ; 20 are computer experts , 40 scientists , and 40 are administritive officers.
